A line segment is an interval of time.

The left intersection with x-axis is the start.

The right intersection with x-axis is the end.

The intersection with y-axis is the label.

Start: follow the left-most gridline to the intersection with the x-axis

End: follow the right-most gridline to the intersection with the x-axis

Duration: subtract the start from the end, or find the length of the line

Label: follow the intersection of the horizontal gridline to the intersection with the y-axis

A point is an interval of time.

The left intersection with x-axis along the triangular gridline is the start.

The right intersection with x-axis along the triangular gridline is the end.

The intersection with y-axis is the duration.

Start: follow the left-most triangular gridline to the intersection with the x-axis

End: follow the right-most triangular gridline to the intersection with the x-axis

Duration: follow the horizontal gridline to the intersection of the point with the y-axis

Label: find the text above the point

Hint: hover your mouse over the data points for help

Each of the clinical trials the Jones lab is conducting requires participants to come into the lab for a particular duration of time. For example, sessions for trial #4 are always one hour long. James thinks that he might have scheduled one of the appointments for the wrong duration.

Which patient needs to be rescheduled?

  • A1
  • B1
  • C1
  • D2
  • E2
  • F3
  • G3
  • H3
  • I4
  • J4

Each of the clinical trials is facilitated by a different researcher. Anne handles trial #1, Bahar handles trial #2, Chris handles trial #3 and Xiao handles trial #4. James thinks that he may have double booked one of the researchers for two appointments at the same time.

Which researcher is double booked, and for what time interval?

  • Anne
  • Bahar
  • Chris
  • Xiao
  • 9-10am
  • 9-12pm
  • 1-3pm
  • 3-4pm
